item.title: About
item.description:
About

I am a researcher focusing on privacy-enhancing technologies and all the cryptographic tools that enable them. My work is mainly centred around (zero-knowledge) proof systems and their security. I also touch on related topics such as threshold cryptography and MPC.

Aside from research, I enjoy writing educational content, explainers and technical summaries for all levels of understanding. You can find some of these articles in the blog section or in the ZK Jargon Decoder.

Now

Last edited on 02 Nov, 2024.

Currently, I am Research Consultant at Bain Capital Crypto. I am also a recurring co-host on the ZeroKnowledge Podcast and a core contributor to ZK Hack.

Ongoing projects and topics of interest include:

  • data availability sampling from pure-ROM protocols.
  • privacy-preserving proof delegation.
  • folding schemes/IVC.

item.title: Research & Projects
item.description:
Research & Projects

A non-exhaustive, somewhat-ordered list of papers, projects and talks that I have given.

Papers

  • [CMKL24] Pricing Factors and TFMs for Scalability-Focused ZK-Rollups.
  • [MSGJ24] Arke: Scalable and Byzantine Fault Tolerant Privacy-Preserving Contact Discovery, ACM CCS '24.
  • [Moh23] Sangria: a Folding Scheme for PLONK.

Projects

  • ZK Whiteboard Sessions: Season 2, content curation and hosting modules.
  • ZK Jargon Decoder, creator and maintainer.
  • ZeroKnowledge Podcast co-host.
  • Aptos Keyless early circuit audit.
  • Paper Speedrun series. A series of short and accessible paper summaries for the Geometry blog.
  • Experimental implementation of functional commitments [BNO21] using arkworks.
  • An arkworks-based library for Mental Poker using threshold encryption and NARKs, with companion blog posts (Pt1 and Pt2).
  • Proof-toolbox: a collection of common tools used in ZK applications.
